materials.raw_text: Ac: 10 g, Ce: 20 g, In: 30 g, Ru: 5 g

sourcing.instructions: Ac (Acetylene) can be purchased from industrial gas suppliers; Ce (Cerium) from chemical suppliers; In (Indium) from metal suppliers; Ru (Ruthenium) from precious metal suppliers.
steps: Ac (Acetylene) can be purchased from industrial gas suppliers; Ce (Cerium) from chemical suppliers; In (Indium) from metal suppliers; Ru (Ruthenium) from precious metal suppliers.

1. Measure 10 g of Ac, 20 g of Ce, 30 g of In, and 5 g of Ru using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the measured ingredients. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a glass rod to ensure even distribution of the components. 4. Transfer the mixture into a mortar and grind it to a fine powder for at least 10 minutes.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 10 g of Ac, 20 g of Ce, 30 g of In, and 5 g of Ru using a digital scale. 2. In a clean, dry container, combine the measured ingredients. 3. Stir the mixture thoroughly using a glass rod to ensure even distribution of the components. 4. Transfer the mixture into a mortar and grind it to a fine powder for at least 10 minutes.

steps: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the powdered mixture into a ceramic crucible. 3. Heat the crucible in the furnace for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat a furnace to 800°C. 2. Place the powdered mixture into a ceramic crucible. 3. Heat the crucible in the furnace for 2 hours to ensure complete reaction and formation of the compound.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible using heat-resistant gloves.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down naturally to room temperature (approximately 4-6 hours). 2. Once cooled, carefully remove the crucible using heat-resistant gloves.

steps: 1. Allow the solid sample to sit at room temperature for an additional 24 hours. 2. Sand the surfaces of the sample to achieve a smooth finish, using progressively finer grit sandpaper (start with 120-grit and finish with 400-grit). 3. Optionally, seal the sample with a clear acrylic sealant to protect the surface.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Allow the solid sample to sit at room temperature for an additional 24 hours. 2. Sand the surfaces of the sample to achieve a smooth finish, using progressively finer grit sandpaper (start with 120-grit and finish with 400-grit). 3. Optionally, seal the sample with a clear acrylic sealant to protect the surface.
